Appellation: Dry Creek Valley, Sonoma, California, US
Description: This blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvedre grapes is beautiful for its freshness and simplicity, offering plump raspberry and blackberry flavors on a full body with little oak influence and great acid/ripeness balance. Best now through 2028.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Quivira 2019 Wine Creek Ranch G-S-M (Dry Creek Valley)Editors' Choice

Appellation: Templeton Gap District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Rich and ripe aromas of spicecake, ginger dust and baked berries show on the nose of this blend of 61% Mourvèdre, 22% Syrah, 16% Grenache and 1% Viognier. The palate lands with a suave texture, showing roasted red plum and caramelized fennel bulb flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: ONX 2019 Level 22 Red (Templeton Gap District)

Description: This full-bodied wine opens immediately with dill, black pepper spices, dried and fresh cranberries. It is reminiscent of a profile that would also satisfy a Rioja drinker. Dark, lush berries evolve in the glass along with hints of green peppercorns, bay leaf and eucalyptus.                      Anna-Christina Cabrales
Name: Domaine Notre Dame des Pallières 2019 Bois des Mourres  (Gigondas)

Description: This is a smashing deal every vintage, and this year's blend of 58% Grenache, 35% Syrah, 4% Mourvèdre and 3% Tempranillo doesn't disappoint. Fresh but savory aromas of roasted red fruit and baking spice drop into a tightly wound palate of snappy red currant and light pepper that rides a zippy acidity through the finish.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Morgan 2020 Cote du Crow's Red (Monterey)Editors' Choice

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Amore is love at first sniff. There's this lovely aromatic interplay between blueberry sorbet, lime zest and a sweet, earthy note like marjoram. Blackberries, saline and cigar box flavors rise quickly from the glass. The wine's mouthfeel is surprisingly fresh and crisp, given the alcohol percentage.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Quiddity 2020 Amore Red (Columbia Valley (WA))

Appellation: Sierra Foothills, Sierra Foothills, California, US
Description: Warm maple and vanilla aromas lead to ripe and generously spicy flavors of cooked berries and  milk chocolate. Blended from 65% Syrah and 35% Petite Sirah, the wine shows ample oak notes in the aromas and on the palate, where soft tannins and a full body keep it broad and supple.                      Jim Gordon
Name: Le Casque 2019 Espion Red (Sierra Foothills)
